description: Unique identifier for a login session, used to track and tie events to a specific userâ€™s active sign-on.
Application login of the person or service associated with the session; may be anonymous when unauthenticated or public access.
Context tag for the session (likely workgroup, web gateway, or workflow name) used to route application behavior; confirm exact meaning with SME.
Operational site or facility context associated to the session (e.g., default warehouse/location for data and permissions); confirm with SME.
Identifier of the client device initiating the session; despite the label, values appear to be IP addresses. Used for auditing and security.
IP address from which the session originated, captured for auditing, geolocation, and security controls.
Effective permission set for the session, likely a numeric code or bitmask indicating access rights; confirm coding scheme with SME.
User or process that created the session record.
Timestamp when the session record was created or the session started (UTC unless otherwise specified).
User or process that last modified the session record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the session record.
Identifier linking the session to an authentication or verification event (e.g., MFA challenge); confirm source and usage with SME.
External account/customer identifier associated with the session; may duplicate login when customers authenticate directly. Confirm mapping rules with SME.
Label or type for the authentication token/provider used for the session (e.g., SSO provider, API key); confirm allowed values with SME.
Free-text notes captured about the session for support or auditing.
Timestamp when the session or its access token expires and is no longer valid.
Opaque token or identifier used to obtain new access tokens and extend the session without reauthentication; handle securely.
